intro: Klaineanthus gaboniae, commonly known as the Gabon flame tree, is a tropical tree native to Central and Southern Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, winged fruits that disperse its seeds. It is often found in savannah and woodland habitats, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant in warmer regions.
